Key Match Events: Five players scored in double figures to help the shorthanded Mavericks defeat the Lakers.
Quentin Grimes tied a career high with nine rebounds against the Lakers.
Late in the fourth quarter, Grimes drove past Austin Reaves and threw a one-handed pass to Washington, who rose vertically for a reverse dunk.
Klay Thompson and Jaden Hardy knocked down three consecutive 3-pointers to help Dallas establish momentum against the Lakers.
Spencer Dinwiddie drove into the paint for an open dunk to cap an 11-0 run.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd emphasized the need to give the group some time to build chemistry.
Quentin Grimes mentioned the increased opportunity to be aggressive with two superstars out.
P.J. Washington highlighted the challenge of finding rhythm without their two best players.
Jason Kidd noted the positive state and energy of the team despite injuries.
